cyclone.name: MINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles WSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward across the Florida Panhandle tonight, then east-northeast across south Georgia and offshore into the western Atlantic on Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle between Mexico Beach and the Steinhatchee River (near Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch/warning limited to Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL (Big Bend/Panhandle)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend tonight, then the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina on Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph in outer rain bands late Wednesday night through early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated at Port Manatee; surge confined to Big Bend coast north of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of brief heavy rain possible as the system’s southern rain shield passes
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk mainly well north of the port
